channel.title: Comments on: SQL Saturday #92 Portland, OR: Wrap-Ups, High-Fives, and Doughnuts
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: John Franko
item.dc:creator: John Franko
item.content:encoded:
Jes, I attended your SSRS presentation at SQL Saturday in Portland. I thought it was outstanding!! In fact, it was the best presentation of all the ones I attended that day. It was also the most humorous presentation and often that’s just what people need in order to really learn something. I wish I had a chance to meet with you personally. Congratulations at the Portland Marathon!! I hope to see you out here in Portland again in the near future.

Cheers, John Franko

item.title: By: Hossam Alfraih (@SaudiGeekNET)
item.dc:creator: Hossam Alfraih (@SaudiGeekNET)
item.content:encoded:
Nice post Jes!

It was nice to meet you in Portland (#sqlSat92) and Seattle (#sqlPass) too!

Unfortunately, I could not make a visit to Voodoo Doughnuts (although, I know it is one of the must to-do in Portland).. but will do in the next year (hopefully)!

Take care.

~ Hossam

item.title: By: Kendra Little
item.dc:creator: Kendra Little
item.content:encoded:
If that’s the worst presentation you’ve ever given, you’re doin’ pretty freaking well. ðŸ™‚

I really enjoyed your presentation at SQL Saturday 92. You got a little behind in terms of the scope you wanted to cover, but you didn’t really waste any time– when you were answering those questions you were doing demos that showed things to the audience. You did it clearly and with enthusiasm and everyone was really with you– and having people with you is what counts.

So even if you’d handle the presentation differently another time, I’d still chalk that one up in the “big success” areas. Because you were very successful at teaching what you brought, and making us all want to learn more.
